text: if you're a fan of baseball rivalries
you probably can't get enough of Boston
Red Sox New York Yankees drama Beckett
vs. Sabathia Jeter and Ellsbury but if
you're a fan of Major League Baseball
you probably don't like what this
rivalry has come to represent that
wealth and a willingness to spend the
moon to get the best players is a
formula for success under this formula
the strong get more while the week was
fade meanwhile the National Football
League has surged light years ahead of
baseball and excitement passion and
expectations that on any given Sunday
any team can win unlike Major League
Baseball the NFL has managed to remove
money as the primary ingredient for
winning and it's placed a premium on
organization and smarts baseball stuck
in a unfulfilled model where you can
predict results in the fall based on who
spends the most money in the winter now
don't get me wrong I like rivalries I
like the Red Sox Yankees drama I just
don't like what has come to represent
